title: Sia reveals she is suffering from the neurological disease Ehlers-Danlos syndrome
text:
Sia has revealed she suffers from Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.

The disease weakens the connective tissue in your body, typically leading to joint pain and super elastic and fragile skin.

'Hey, I'm suffering with chronic pain, a neurological disease, ehlers danlos (sic),' the singer, 43, began.

Open and honest: Sia, 43, took to Twitter on Friday afternoon to reveal she's suffering from Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, a disease that weakens the connective tissue in your body, typically leading to joint pain and super elastic and fragile skin

Not alone: 'Hey, I'm suffering with chronic pain, a neurological disease, ehlers danlos (sic),' the Australian singer-songwrite began

While Ehlers-Danlos syndromes can manifest neurologically in symptoms like headaches, fatigue and muscle weakness, it isn't considered a neurological disease, and Sia didn't specify what neurological disease or symptom she was suffering from.

The Australian singer-songwriter, born Sia Furler, continued her tweet with a motivational message to fans who may also be struggling.

'I just wanted to say to those of you suffering from pain, whether physical or emotional, I love you, keep going. Life is f—ing hard. Pain is demoralizing, and you're not alone (sic),' she finished.

Followers flocked to Sia's social media pages to thank her for her candor and offer words of support.

Keep going: 'I just wanted to say to those of you suffering from pain, whether physical or emotional, I love you, keep going. Life is fucking hard. Pain is demoralizing, and you're not alone (sic),' Sia finished (pictured during a performance at the Los Angeles LGBT Center on September 21)

'You inspire so many of us, @Sia. Take care of your body & heart, on your terms. We love you right back. ❤️,' Singer-Songwriter Mary Lambert replied.

'thanks for always being so honest, this means a lot for people in similar situations.. You’re an incredibly strong woman who keeps inspiring many around the world. We LOVE you and support you, always ❤️(sic),' another follower wrote.

According to The Ehlers-Danlos Society, there are thirteen different types of Ehlers-Danlos syndromes.

They're generally characterized by 'joint hypermobility (joints that stretch further than normal), skin hyperextensibility (skin that can be stretched further than normal), and tissue fragility.'

Inspiration: Followers flocked to Sia's social media pages to thank her for her candor and offer words of support

Joint hypermobility can cause loose and unstable joints which leads to a number of issues, including frequent dislocations as well as early onset osteoarthritis.

And skin hyperextensibility can lead to fragile skin that tears or bruises easily, severe scarring and slow, poor wound healing, among other things.

Other issues caused by Ehlers-Danlos syndromes can include: chronic early onset debilitating musculoskeletal pain, arterial/intestinal/uterine fragility or rupture, scoliosis, poor muscle tone, mitral valve prolapse and gum disease.

The disorder is rare, affecting only 1 in 5,000 individuals worldwide.

Showstopper: Sia joined show business as a teenager singing in the acid jazz band Crisp and is known for the wig she wears to hide her face (pictured in February of 2017 in Beverly Hills, California)

Regardless, Sia hasn't let her pain keep her from her craft.

The Cheap Thrills hitmaker recently performed at the LA LGBT Center's 50th anniversary event wearing her signature black-and-white wig with a giant bow on her head.

Sia joined show business as a teenager singing in the acid jazz band Crisp and is known for the wig she wears to hide her face.

She's won a number of awards including an ARIA Awards and an MTV Video Music Award.
description: The Elastic Heart singer has painfully elastic skin. Sia revealed she's suffering from Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, a disease that weakens the connective tissue in your body.
